akn:content.akn:p: A hearing for judging a violation actionable under this chapter shall be held before a hearing examiner referred to in ยง 8-808, and the hearing shall be conducted according to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2.
In the case of a person who is found liable for a violation, the hearing examiner may order the respondent to do any or all of the following:
An order rendered pursuant to a determination that a violation has been established, or pursuant to the receipt of a response admitting the violation, shall be a civil order.

A person who has responded to a notice of violation and fails, without good cause, to appear at the scheduled hearing shall be liable for a penalty equal to twice the amount of the civil fine plus any costs of abating or preventing the violation consistent with provisions of ยง 8-807.
If a person to whom a notice of violation has been issued fails to appear at a hearing, then the hearing examiner may proceed with the hearing and render a final disposition of the case.
